item

Class Catalog

  • java.lang.Object
    • item.Catalog

  • public class Catalog
extends java.lang.Object
    A catalog represents a parallel array between a set of Items and their amounts.
    See Also:
    TODO: Many methods are very hard to interpret; clear confusion.

      Consumes an item, reducing its associated amount by one.

      Gets the entirety of all items in the game, with amounts set to one.

      • Catalog

        public Catalog()

    • Method Detail

      • getItems

        public java.util.List<Item> getItems()
        Gets the items in the catalog, without the bound amounts, as a List.
        Returns:
        A List of items.

      • insertItem

        public void insertItem(Item i)
        Attempts to insert an item onto the catalog. If the item exists, the amounts list does NOT change.
        Parameters:
        i - The item to insert.

      • insertItem

        public void insertItem(Item i,
                       int amt)
        Attempts to insert a number of the same item onto the catalog. If the item already exists, the amounts list changes.
        Parameters:
        i - The item to insert.
        amt - The number of items to add.

      • consumeItem

        public Item consumeItem(int itemID)
        Consumes an item, reducing its associated amount by one. If this brings the item's amount to zero, the item and it's associated amount are both removed.
        Parameters:
        ID - The Item id.
        Returns:
        The item removed if the item can be found in the catalog, null otherwise.

      • consumeAll

        public org.javatuples.Pair<Item,java.lang.Integer> consumeAll(int itemID)
        Consumes all instances of an item.
        Parameters:
        itemID - The Item id.
        Returns:
        The item and amount removed if the item can be found, null otherwise.

      • transferFrom

        public void transferFrom(Catalog donator)
        Transfers all item/amount pairs from the donator into this catalog, clearing all items from the donator as a result.
        Parameters:
        donator - The catalog to transfer from.

      • clearCatalog

        public java.util.List<org.javatuples.Pair<Item,java.lang.Integer>> clearCatalog()
        Removes all items in the catalog, and returns the catalog.
        Returns:
        The catalog.

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Is the list empty?
        Returns:
        True if the list is empty, false otherwise.

      • sortCatalogById

        public void sortCatalogById()
        Sorts the given catalog by id in ascending order.
        Parameters:
        catalog - The catalog.

      • getEntireItemCatalog

        public static java.util.List<Item> getEntireItemCatalog()
        Gets the entirety of all items in the game, with amounts set to one. TODO: A bit obtrusive, since the method must be updated every time a new class is created.
        Returns:

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
